title: How to Dress Up Band Aids with Washi Tape

steps.headline: Obtain the desired number of Band-Aid sizes and shapes.
steps.description: Consider keeping a one-month supply on hand at all times.

steps.headline: Measure the first Band-Aid.
steps.description: Transfer the measurements to the first piece of Washi tape.

steps.headline: Cut the Washi tape to size (or in a shape if using one).
steps.description: Apply to the top of the Band-Aid. Smooth out any wrinkles, then move onto the next piece.

steps.headline: Set up an area where your child can make his or her own Washi tape Band-Aids.
steps.description:
In some cases, engaging your child in a small craft will take his or her mind off any injury and bring the focus back to something fun. Find a shoebox or larger empty tin to keep your supplies. Include a pair of sharp scissors in addition to the Band Aids and assortment of Washi tape. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/36\/Dress-Up-Band-Aids-with-Washi-Tape-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Dress-Up-Band-Aids-with-Washi-Tape-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/36\/Dress-Up-Band-Aids-with-Washi-Tape-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Dress-Up-Band-Aids-with-Washi-Tape-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Allow your child to select the Washi tape he or she would like to cover the Band-Aid with.
Measure and cut the Washi Tape for your child.
steps.description: Then allow your child to apply it to the Band-Aid independently (or with your assistance if needed).

steps.headline: Finished.
steps.description: Your child will delight in wearing the self-created pretty Band-Aids.

text:
Creating the Washi Tape Band-Aids Obtain the desired number of Band-Aid sizes and shapes. Consider keeping a one-month supply on hand at all times. Measure the first Band-Aid. Transfer the measurements to the first piece of Washi tape. Cut the Washi tape to size (or in a shape if using one). Apply to the top of the Band-Aid. Smooth out any wrinkles, then move onto the next piece. Involving your Child Set up an area where your child can make his or her own Washi tape Band-Aids. In some cases, engaging your child in a small craft will take his or her mind off any injury and bring the focus back to something fun. Find a shoebox or larger empty tin to keep your supplies. Include a pair of sharp scissors in addition to the Band Aids and assortment of Washi tape. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/36\/Dress-Up-Band-Aids-with-Washi-Tape-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Dress-Up-Band-Aids-with-Washi-Tape-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/36\/Dress-Up-Band-Aids-with-Washi-Tape-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Dress-Up-Band-Aids-with-Washi-Tape-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Allow your child to select the Washi tape he or she would like to cover the Band-Aid with. Measure and cut the Washi Tape for your child. Then allow your child to apply it to the Band-Aid independently (or with your assistance if needed). Finished. Your child will delight in wearing the self-created pretty Band-Aids.
